frame.name: Store
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Supply</fen> of a <fen>Resource</fen> is kept safe and available for a future <fen>Use</fen>. The <fen>Supply</fen> may be under the control of a <fen>Possessor</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Possessor">Our</fex> <t>supply</t> <fex name="Resource">of food</fex> is running low.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Supply
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes the <fen>Supply</fen> of <fen>Resource</fen>s. It is incorporated into each LU in this frame.</def-root>

FE.name: Resource
FE.definition:
<def-root>The goods or commodity that is being stored in a <fen>Supply</fen>.
<ex> India has made great strides in agriculture and now not only meets it own grain needs but has a sizeable <t>reserve</t> <fex name="res">of basic grains, mainly rice and wheat</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition:
<def-root>The future <fen>Use</fen> for the <fen>Resource</fen>.
<ex>Due to restrictions imposed by our export control, the Japanese have begun to use a portion of their <fex name="use">war</fex> <t>reserve</t> of petroleum.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity that possesses the <fen>Supply</fen>.
<ex>In 1997, <fex name="pos">France's</fex> <t>stock</t> of unirradiated civil plutonium increased to 72 tons.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characterization of the <fen>Supply</fen> itself, rather than the <fen>Resource</fen>.
<ex>Institutions have focused on Broward County?s <fex name="des">dwindling</fex> <t>supply</t> of land, continued population growth and elevated income levels.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: store.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a quantity or supply kept for use as needed.

lexUnit.name: stock.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a supply of goods or materials available for sale or use

lexUnit.name: stockpile.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large accumulated stock of goods or materials.

lexUnit.name: supply.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a stock or amount of something supplied or available.

lexUnit.name: inventory.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a quantity of goods in stock.

lexUnit.name: reserve.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a reserved supply of a commodity.

lexUnit.name: cargo.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a quantity of goods that is roughly equivalent to that which can be stored in a cargohold of some kind
